result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

3:33 PM Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dedonlamentrin Donrell Shuford in court, in custody. Attorney Michael A. Forella III in court for Dedonlamentrin Donrell Shuford. Dr. Seipel appears by zoom. Court asks DE if he believes he is competent, incompetent or standing mute. DE does not answer the question. Court states that he is making the decision that the DE is standing mute. ADA Huber is stating that the DE is not competent. Dr. Seipel is sworn in. Testimony taken from Dr. Seipel. Arguments heard from State and Defense. Court finds that the DE is incompetent to proceed but believes he is likely to regain competency in the time frame. Court enters involuntary medication order and orders the DE to the Department of Health and Human Services. 
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Attorney Michael Forella

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant appeared in custody in person.  Clerk. M.Burke. DE states he has not read the Dr.'s report. Court appoints counsel to represent the DE in the issue of competency. Attorney Forella is appointed. Br 2 is going to hear the matter of competency. CH set over to 09/13/22 at 3:30.
Notice of Assignment of JudgeReturned from the United Postal Service. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward.
Notice of assignment of Judge returned. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward.
Clerk emailed SPD Office regarding CH on 8/30/22 at 2 pm and whether DE is eligible for SPD appointment.

02:13 PM State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant, Dedonlamentrin Donrell Shuford, appeared in custody by zoom.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF1017/22CM920. DE states that there is nothing wrong with him and that he did not speak with anyone from the SPD Office. Court will refer the defendant to the SPD Office to see if he is eligible for SPD appointment. Court will allow the doctor to appear by zoom for the next hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
and Comp Report

02:11 PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  DE in custody but No Appearance - behavior issues.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Competency hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Temp. $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
